comments.body: I like this idea. However, I think that you can make parts of statues like an arm, baseplate, ect. Then put the pieces in the crafting table to get your statue.
you should be able to use the stone statues as armor stands too. i would love to have some prismarine guardians!

I like the idea of single block mob statues that can be used as toppers for fountains or decoration for buildings, although multi-block ones the size of actual mobs would also be pretty cool. You could use them to represent beasties turned to stone by magic or some unknown critter as yet unseen!
I think it would also be cool if you could have statues in the shape of the player and maybe in different poses too
Yes, it will be nice!

Great idea! 

And building upon the fact they could generate near witch huts: What if they formed a trail that you could follow to find witches huts more easily? And because the lanterns glow, they could be spaced out so in the day its harder to follow the trail, but in the night the lanterns glow forms a path towards the hut.
This would be very aesthetically pleasing!

Yes, I need this! I had to give up a project because it was too long to fill all the maps... :(

Also it would be great to allow a command that would give you an already filled map of a chosen location, so that you wouldn't have to move at all in creative mode.
Turn individual wool into string or carpets, or turn string into spider webs.
This would be great for me and I'm sure many others. I hate having to go out at night to kill spiders for string; do you realize how many times I've died trying to do that!?

This has an immediate impact on the meta of the world, making üêè a far more valuable asset, and for much the same reason that they were historically. Honestly, it baffles me that we can not do it already!

(I came to this feedback site, in part, to suggest this idea, I should not be surprised that it is already a thing.)

Sorry for the double comments, but this is important enough to warrant it I feel: I suggest that we have two new recipes: the "Spindle" & "spinning": it takes two sticks and a wooden slab placed in a vertical row in the crafting bench to make one: its a tool that can shier a sheep, but instead of yielding 1-3 pieces of wool it gives 1-3 string. Alternatively, you can put it in a crafting bench along with 1-8 pieces of wool and craft it down, this destroys the spindle but turns each piece of wool into 3 strings. (And like making a boat, it can be almost out of durability when you do that, so use it on live sheep till it's almost worn out, the spin up a pile of wool-blocks to maximize the yield-per-spindle!)

It appears there is already an existing thread on this topic (or something very similar). Feel free to join that discussion in progress. Cutting down on threads with very similar ideas will ideas to stay together so they can receive the attention they deserve from our developers. Even though you may not agree with all the exact ideas in the other thread(s), we love it when the community works together on ideas!

The Search box is located on every single page of the Feedback site. Just enter a word or two about the topic you want to post about and hit return. You may want to try alternate or common misspellings! It's amazing what you can find with one word.

Thanks for your contribution.

As a quick note, this is the thread the mod ment

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360040653771-Villager-Town-Fortress-Illager-version

(At least i think)
This would be a great idea and maybe Pillager Outposts could protect these towns, acting as watchtowers. They could be changed slightly but still be similar
It would also make it easier to stack minecarts ontop of one another in redstone circuits.
I agree, because I LOVE building rollercoasters and this would be pretty helpful.
they should really do this for console addition too. several gray blocks are purple.

Other things I'd like to add on to maps as well as of:
‚Ä¢ choose-able map border colors. Since console users can't use mods, I generally allow someone to 'claim' an entire size 0 map as their territory. Would be nice to be able to assign like red, blue, green, ECT borders to maps so when they're displayed together on a wall as a big map, it's easy to identify who's I'm which map
‚Ä¢ functional wall maps. As is maps show wall mounted locations, but it'd be nice to see other players on maps displayed on walls. Would give reason for players having a map room too
‚Ä¢ a way to not be located on a map. If you want to keep your position hidden. Could possibly allow hidden location toggle that turned off if you hit a player
I never even thought about it that way.
This would be perfect and if all mob heads get added in game then there will be even more possibilities!
I think right clicking it should change pitches for more customization.
Some of these enchantments don't make sense.
This seems like something for TNT and not the Flint and Steel item.

I actually have multiple ideas for TNT:

Glowing

- Fire

- Potion

- Dragon

- Sticky

- Shulker

- Transmit

- Amplifying

- Firework

- Timed

- Arrow

Since we're talking about Flint and Steel, I also have an enchantment idea for them as well.

Flame Burst Enchantment

@Blast Burner TNT are blocks, they can't have enchantments. Either way it would be more convenient to carry around multiple types of flint and steel and have a stack of normal TNT, than the other way around.

As for your own posts, try to be more concise.
@Camcamcam753  Sorry Camcamcam753 but what you're saying in this post really affects the TNT more then the Flint and Steel item.
@Camcamcam753  In this post are you trying to say enchantments for Flint and Steel that affect TNT Blocks?
@Blast Burner yes, similar to how a bow enchantment affects the arrow.

Isn't this something from Tinkers? It sounds pretty familiar. I do agree that the nether star needs to do something else because I am not going to kill hundreds of wither skeletons to just get a beacon. I'm just not sure if this is the right answer. Sorry, that's just my opinion.

The skillet and the mechanics of its combat are decent, not the best I've seen however. But the idea of a skillet, being a weapon, is absurd to me. Minecraft's weapons are to be medieval/ fantasy. No vote.

Thanks for the feedback Some Animal. It is funny how people see things differently in Minecraft. I always sort of saw Minecraft as a post apocalyptic world that only returned to the old was out of necessity. May be that is because I first played Minecraft with Tekkit then sort of grew into Vanilla. To me the past was always full of more tech I suppose. That is the beauty of this game isn't it it is however you see it. It is what ever you want it to be. 

I consed that the cast iron skillet wasn't popularized until the advent of the kitchen stove in the 19th century but other metal pans were used in ancient Mesopotamia so it doesn't necessarily not fit into your vision of Minecraft IMO.

I would like to know what parts of the mechanics you liked and didn't like. If you have any thoughts as to why you feel the way you do (like you did by telling me that the pan didn't fit the theme of the other weapons) That would be very much appreciated!

Thanks again for your input.  I appreciate you taking the time to offer it!

I liked the ability of the skillet being a tool that was placed to cook, be it on a campfire or a furnace. It would add much for builders. I also liked the fighting mechanics, of being able too knock people back. As I believe skillets should be purely for cooking. Even if it was post-apocalypse style in Minecraft, this isn't Pubg as to have a skillet as a weapon. The idea of a bludgeoning weapon with high knockback is great, however, maybe a mace or a club would better fit the style of minecraft.
this is more like a joke, and mostlikely would be . used cuz this is way to OP

My dad came up with an idea exactly like this. But I have an extra idea, how about you add more foods into the game as well. You can do fried porkchop, fried steak, fried or scramble eggs, fried fish, and fried chicken. 

At least include the fried or scrambled eggs. It's been added into the game! It needs to be finished!

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.

I'm not sure about the area of effect potion dispersing. I don't see what use it would have. A beacon (which does something similar) is only useful because of the large radius it has. I do like the idea of combining campfires with cauldrons, though.

Any use should take into account that cauldrons are made of iron, though, and so are not going to be used before the player has settled down.

I think the use should be one concerning potions, since I'm in favour of making cauldrons actually useful for making them. What, I don't know, though.
Perhaps potions would 'condense' when left in a cauldron over a campfire. The longer the potion is left there, the longer it will last?

What if cauldrons over a fire could be used to evaporate the potion but leave all/some of the potion ingredients behind, sort of like recycling potions? I‚Äôm sure many people make mistakes when making a potion and the ability to reverse a potion might be good.
Maybe they could replace making stews and soups with crafting tables and use campfires and cauldrons instead.

Heating the cauldrons may cause the potion to bubble over and/or create a lingering cloud. At the very least, this could be used for decoration. Imagine having this in a cemetery with the cauldrons creating a sort of fog.
That is totally not true!
You think we Java players can craft Enchanted Gapples? I wish so.
We to have to search for the God Apples in dungeons so you're not the only one.
Aside from Blas Burner raging about Java players struggling with this as well, I do agree that enchanted golden apples should be slightly more common.
I would like to say MONDAIJI666 that I am perfectly calm about this. lol

They can be found in woodland mansions, dungeons, mineshafts, and desert pyramids. The Minecraft wiki says they can be found in woodland mansions with the sane probability as Java, and does bot mention other structures, which can mislead readers into thinking they only generate in woodland mansions. I know Toycat has found them in desert pyramids.

It is stated that way on the wiki because it is generated using a template rather than manually, and woodland mansions use a different loot table on different editions.

True. The highest chance are in mansions(and we all know how rare those are already) with 3.1% probability. EncGApples dont generate in Desert temples in Bedrock according to the wiki. Or at leazt the loot table isnt shown there. So i agree they should make it more common. I already searched thru 20+ ruined portals, 10+ desert temples and a few mineshafts and none of them had an enchanted apple.

i have spent literal days searching hundreds of thousands of blocks, i have travelled all the way through to 500,000 blocks from my original spawn and have not found a single enchanted apple (EGA), either make the EGA easier to find/ more common or please ramp up the reward factor for each EGA achievement for example its 20 and 30 gamerscore on xbox please take it too 50 or something each, the gap between difficulty on the majority of achievements is like the offspring of an ant compared to the fat leap to find the EGA on at most a 3.1% chance inside of the small chance of finding a woodland mansion...
I am more of a "get stacked" type of person, so I suggest you don't actually get those colors easily.

I think using dye in an anvil would be a logical way to do this. It's not overpowered, it's just something that's cosmetic and gives no advantages other than allowing you to do something that was previously only possible with commands.
Farts in Minecraft...... it's just not going to happen.
Its not going to happen but I want it to. XD Imagine your going to fall to your death then, you eat baked beans and fart. Finally, you save yourself.
We also need bean burritos and graphic farts to fly !
KILL IT. KILL IT ALL.

I doubt the farts are gonna happen, but maybe using beans, chicken, and wheat, you could make a burrito. A burrito could heal five hunger. It could be crafted like this:

empty/empty/empty

chicken/beans/chicken

wheat/wheat/wheat
awesome.
Great idea! This definitely should be added to the game!
This would be great, but I doubt they will do this. In the mean time, just use shulker boxes with an item frame.
Since this wasn't explained at all, I clarified the subject line and put it in the correct category in case someone wanted to look for it. Feel free to edit and explain more about this idea!
Hope it can be used to destroy bedrock, which becomes flat
Using the dragon egg as a way to make a pickaxe makes no sense at all. If the dragon egg were to be useful, they need to stay loyal towards Notch's dragon idea.
what happens when the pickaxe breaks?
That sounds insane what can it do
Illogical to craft a hardy tool with something as fragile as an egg. There's better uses for the dragon egg.
If used in end, it will hatch ender dragon (if already deafeated)
Breakes blocks extreamly fast

I want to elaborate on this because I think this is THE way to add more food items to minecraft. I think I speak for everyone in that we'd all love more food in the game, but its hard to justify adding any of it. However if its harder to farm certain crops in certain temperatures, then each biome can have its own "cuisine" so to speak. I don't think it would be too hard to add a system like this without needing to adjust things too much.

Adverse weather like heat or frost would slow down crop growth, and very hot or very cold weather could even wilt crops not hydrated. If there's a heatwave, soil dries up and water only hydrates soil adjacent to the water block. Just determine the rate of adverse weather affecting the crops based on exposure to the Sky level, and I think that's all you'd need.

 

Well...I say that's all you'd need, but you'd need the weather too. Its obviously not that simple, but I think the effort would be well worth it!
Who`

• Fried/cooked eggplant
  • If thrown at villagers, gives them a higher chance to produce offspring, because who doesn't like kidnapping the villagers to take all the trades?
  • if used to breed animals then maybe they could make it like tofu from slime rancher, feeding them breeds them, but also allows breeding process to go by quicker. More breeding in shorter time.

Now with the Cave and Cliffs update this would be even more important with vast open caves with no light. It is always hard to place torches around super tall ravines and caves, but with a throwable light source it would be easy.
This should be revived as an idea. With the new glowsquid and glow lichen, there should be a way to throw a glow lichen up high onto walls.

This is a great idea, especially in 1.18.  I don't think a temporary light would be very helpful though.  Maybe there could be a light source that's shootable with bow or crossbow.  Possibly it could be connected somehow with the frogs from the Wild Update.
